required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Choroidal Thickness Change in Response to Physiological and Refractive Changes
clinical_study.official_title: Automatic Measurements of Choroidal Thickness Change in Response to Physiological and Refractive Changes

lead_sponsor.agency: Wrocław University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Wrocław University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: There is a great need for precise and repeatable measurements of the choroidal thickness. Including the diurnal physiological changes, accommodation and refractive error impact on those measurements.

primary_outcome.description: OCT EDI recorded scans will be proceed with the custom-made software to determine choroidal thickness in the submacular region.
OCT EDI recorded scans will be proceed with the custom-made software to determine choroidal thickness in the peripapillar region.

secondary_outcome.measure: Angle to angle diameter of anterior chamber
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with optical coherent tomography for anterior chamber
Measured with optical coherent tomography for anterior chamber

secondary_outcome.measure: Corneal keratometry (steep meridian and its axis and flat meridian with its axis)
secondary_outcome.description: Keratometry from autorefractokeratometer, topography or tomography recordings, radius measured in mm, magnitude of corneal astigmatism measured in local changes of dioptric power.

secondary_outcome.measure: Spherical ametropia with cylindrical power of correcting lenses
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective refraction made by trained optometrist. Spherical ametropia measured by dioptric power of spherical equivalent lens and magnitude of astigmatism measured in cylindrical dioptries of correcting lens with its axis. Mode of notation: sphero-cylinder with negative cylinder (e.g. +0.50DS -0.50DC 180ax)
examined on ETDRS charts different for right and left eye

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- participants with refractive error
- willing and able to understand and sign an informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient unable to participate in the study
- any disease that causes visual opacity of optic media that unable to perform OCT scanning
- current enrolment in another clinical trial/research project

overall_official.affiliation: Wrocław University of Science and Technology

patient_data.ipd_description: We intend to share anonymised data
